intro: Glochidion zeylanicum var. arunachalense, commonly known as the Arunachal glochidion, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India and parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. It has smooth, glabrous stems and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. This variant is notable for its distinct morphology and ecological adaptations to its native habitat.
